sen.j: 久我 通前（こが みちさき、天正19年10月14日 (旧暦)（1591年11月29日） - 寛永12年10月24日 (旧暦)（1635年12月3日））は、江戸時代前期の公卿。
sen.e: Michisaki KOGA (November 29, 1591 - December 3, 1635) was a Kugyo (court noble) in the early Edo period.
Michisaki KOGA (November 29, 1591 - December 3, 1635) was a Kugyo (court noble) during the early Edo period.
Michisaki KOGA (November 29, 1591 - December 3, 1635) was a Kugyo (court noble) during the early Edo period.

sen.j: 主に後水尾天皇（108代）・明正天皇（109代）に仕え、官位は正三位権中納言まで昇る。
sen.e: He mainly served the Emperor Gomizunoo (108th) and the Emperor Meisho (109th) and his official rank was raised to Shosanmi Gon Chunagon (Senior Third Rank, provisional vice-councilor of state.)
He mainly served Emperor Gomizunoo (108th) and Emperor Meisho (109th) and his official rank was raised to Shosanmi Gon Chunagon (Senior 3rd Rank, provisional vice-councilor of state.)
He mainly served Emperor Gomizunoo (108th) and Emperor Meisho (109th) and his official rank was raised to Shosanmi Gon Chunagon (Senior Third Rank, provisional vice-councilor of state).

sen.j: 父は権大納言久我敦通。
sen.e: His father was Gon Dainagon (Provisional Major Counselor) Atsumichi KOGA.
His father was Gon Dainagon (Provisional Major Counselor) Atsumichi KOGA.
His father was Gon Dainagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state) Atsumichi KOGA.

sen.j: 母は権大納言久我晴通の養女。
sen.e: His mother was an adopted daughter of Gon Dainagon (Provisional Major Counselor) Haremichi KOGA.
His mother was an adopted daughter of Gon Dainagon (Provisional Major Counselor) Haremichi KOGA.
His mother was an adopted daughter of Gon Dainagon Haremichi KOGA.

sen.j: 弟に久我通世・久世通式がいる。
sen.e: His younger brothers were Michiyo KOGA, Michinori KUZE.
sen.cmt: 「久世通式」は、用語集には「Michishiki KUZE」とありましたが、ウィキペディア (http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%B9%85%E4%B8%96%E9%80%9A%E5%BC%8F) には「くぜ みちのり」とありましたので、「Michinori KUZE」と訳出しました。
sen.e: His younger brothers were Michiyo KOGA, Michinori KUZE.
His younger brothers were Michiyo KOGA, Michinori KUZE.
His wife was a daughter of Hideharu HORI.
His wife was a daughter of Hideharu HORI.
His wife was a daughter of Hideharu HORI.

sen.j: 子に左近衛中将久我堯通、内大臣久我広通、千種有能室。
sen.e: His children were Sakone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) Takamichi KOGA, Naidaijin (minister of the center) Hiromichi KOGA, Ariyoshi CHIGUSA's lawful wife.
His children were Sakone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) Takamichi KOGA, Naidaijin (minister of the center) Hiromichi KOGA, Ariyoshi CHIGUSA's lawful wife.
His children were Sakone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) Takamichi KOGA, Naidaijin (minister of the center) Hiromichi KOGA, Ariyoshi CHIGUSA's lawful wife.

sen.j: 元和 (日本)元年（1615年）に叙爵。
sen.e: In 1615 he was raised to the peerage.
In 1615 he was raised to peerage.
In 1615 he was raised to peerage.

sen.j: 以降累進して、侍従・右近衛少将・左近衛中将を経て、寛永元年（1624年）後水尾天皇の中宮徳川和子の中宮権亮となるも寛永6年（1629年）の天皇の退位にともない辞職。
sen.e: Thereafter he was successively promoted to Jiju (Chamberlain), Ukone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), Sakone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), and in 1624 he became Chugu Gon no suke (Provisional Assistant Master of the Consort's Household) of Masako TOKUGAWA, Chugu (the Empress) of the Emperor Gomizunoo, but he resigned his post when the Emperor abdicated in 1629.

Thereafter he was successively promoted to Jiju (Chamberlain), Ukone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), Sakone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), and in 1624 he became Chugu Gon no suke (Provisional Assistant Master of the Consort's Household) of Masako TOKUGAWA, Chugu (the Empress) of the Emperor Gomizunoo, but he resigned his post when the Emperor abdicated in 1629.

Thereafter he was successively promoted to Jiju (Chamberlain), Ukone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), Sakone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), and in 1624 he became Chugu Gon no suke (Provisional Assistant Master of the Consort's Household) of Masako TOKUGAWA, Chugu (the Empress) of the Emperor Gomizunoo, but he resigned his post when the Emperor abdicated in 1629.

sen.j: 寛永7年（1630年）より権中納言に転じた。
sen.e: In 1630 he transferred to Gon Chunagon (provisional vice-councilor of state.)
In 1630 he transferred to Gon Chunagon (provisional vice-councilor of state.)
In 1630 he transferred to Gon Chunagon (provisional vice-councilor of state).

sen.j: 寛永8年（1631年）に正三位となったが、寛永12年（1635年）には薨去した。
sen.e: In 1631 he became Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank), but in 1635 he passed away.
In 1631 he became Shosanmi (Senior 3rd Rank), but in 1635 he passed away.
In 1631 he became Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank), but in 1635 he passed away.
He died at the age of 36.
He died at the age of thirty-six.
He died at the age of thirty-six.
